preprocessor package¶

Submodules¶

preprocessor.preprocessing module¶

preprocessor.preprocessing.import_dataset(url)¶

Function to import the dataset from an url (lacaly on the computer)

Parameters

url – String for the file path

Returns

dataset

:raise : Exception if dataset format isn’t .csv or .data

preprocessor.preprocessing.min_max_scaling(dataset)¶

Function to scale the data set with a minMax Sklearn scaler

Parameters

dataset – Pandas dataframe

Returns

result the dataset sclaled

preprocessor.preprocessing.normalize(dataset)¶

Function that normalize the dataset with sklearn normalizer :param dataset:

Pandas dataframe

Returns

result the dataset normalized

preprocessor.preprocessing.polynomial_scaling(dataset)¶

Function to scale the data set with a polynomial Sklearn scaler

Parameters

dataset – Pandas dataframe

Returns

result the dataset scaled

preprocessor.preprocessing.preprocessing(dataset, n_split, n_norm)¶

Function that make all the preprocessing on a given dataset

Parameters

  • dataset – Pandas dataframe

  • n_split – int : split number to choose the split technique : 1 : random_state = 30, 2 : random_state = 20, 3: random_state = 10

  • n_norm –

    intnormalization number to choose the normalization technique1: StandardScaling, 2: MinMax,

    3: Polynomial, 4: Normalizer

Returns

x_train, x_test, y_train, y_test

:raise : Exception if the entry for scaling isn’t known (1,2,3,4)

preprocessor.preprocessing.standard_scaling(dataset)¶

Function to scale the data set with a Standard Sklearn scaler

Parameters

dataset – Pandas dataframe

Returns

result the dataset scaled
